content.description: Start in the V-shaped notch. Climb up and left on slopers. The top-out jugs are dirty at the time of posting.
content.location: When hiking up to the Airfield, you will turn right around a section of cliff and come to a flat section a few minutes later. There will be a rock cliffband to your right, a steep hill left and behind you, and a dry meadow in front of you. The Snail boulder is on your right at the end of the little cliffband. This specific line is obvious (V-notch feature) and faces a large white dome in the distant.

content.description:
Fun big movement on small, smooth, funky, non-injurious holds on a nice shield of rock.

Start on the chest high holds and make your way up and right to finish on good holds.
content.location: On the boulder just downhill from the Airfield arete boulder. Just right of the Croissant.

content.description: Like Tombstone, but start sitting to the right of the regular start on two crimps. Make a big move left to the sloper, then move right to jugs and left to crimps. Mantling to the left is easier, just don't use the adjacent rock.
content.location: The middle of the tall overhanging face, down low on crimps, in a corridor/cave feature just downhill of the first few boulders at the Airfield. The landing is rocky.

content.description: start on goo triangular ledge and move right to a good jug, make moves up and left on crimps to below the lip and top out.
content.location: in the cave. enter through narrow corridor on downhill side.

content.description: Start matched on a great crimp in the center of the cliffband. Two moves to match the sloping lip and a mantle await. It's actually kind of fun despite the looks. The guidebook gave this a V5, but I thought it was closer to V2. I'll give it the benefit of the doubt and call it a V4, but hopefully more people can offer some opinions.
content.location: When hiking up to the Airfield, you will turn right around a section of cliff and come to a flat section a few minutes later. There will be a rock cliffband to your right, a steep hill left and behind you, and a little meadow in front of you. This line ascends the middle of the short cliffband. There will be an obvious incut crimp rail in the middle of it.

content.description: Start on two crimps. Move right to a big sidepull, topping out on jugs. First few moves are fun.
content.location: When hiking up to the Airfield, you will turn right around a section of cliff and come to a flat section a few minutes later. There will be a rock cliffband to your right, a steep hill left and behind you, and a little meadow in front of you. The Snail boulder is on your right at the end of the little cliffband. This specific line faces the way you come from, on two flat crimps. You'll also see a big right sidepull.

content.description: Start matched on a sloping shelf and dyno up to the sloping rail. Match, throw a heel and climb to the right and up using small edges and good body tension.
content.location: In the last cluster of boulders, just to the left of Punxsutawney Phil. Look for the two chalked up start holds below a faint dihedral.

content.description: Start standing on a big crimp. Use a high right sloping foothold to stand up onto the slab, make a few tricky moves, then press out the top.
content.location: When hiking up to the Airfield, you will turn right around a section of cliff and come to a flat section a few minutes later. There will be a rock cliffband to your right, a steep hill left and behind you, and a little meadow in front of you. This line is at the beginning of the cliffband. There is a tree directly to the right of the start (and some of its branches are impossible to not dab on, unfortunately). To the left of this line is Nameless Page

content.description: I started matched on the arete with a high right heel hook and move left hand out to side pull. Work your feet up and slap your right hand up a couple times. Throw big left up to a good edge and squeeze and continue bump up. Move right and top out on small feet with jugs on top. Really good movement.
content.location: Past the Tombstone Cave and further back below the cliff band. The brush is thick but manageable.

content.description:
I'm surprised this thing has so little traffic. It climbs quite well with a fun, powerful bottom and technical top. If the rock quality was better, it would be 4 stars in my opinion.

Start on the lowest left facing sidepull to the right of the tree. Climb straight up using sidepulls, pockets, and crimps for a slabby finish with some hard to see feet.

The original name of this route is born of a racist tradition. If you don't recognize the route name in the guidebook, that's why.
content.location: When hiking up to the Airfield, you will turn right around a section of cliff and come to a flat section a few minutes later. There will be a rock cliffband to your right, a steep hill left and behind you, and a little meadow in front of you. This line is at the beginning of the cliffband. There is a tree directly to the right of the start (and some of its branches are impossible to not dab on, unfortunately).

content.description:
One of the most fun juggy problems in the whole canyon, but you have to hike pretty far uphill to find it.

Climb up the left side of the Turnover/Croissant boulder, with big jugs all the way.
content.location: Up in the Airfield, at the boulder just downhill of the Airfield Arete

content.description:
Another perfect granite arete in Leavenworth. Clean rock, great position, and a little spicy feel make this climb incredibly special, and worth the hike up to the Airfield.

Start standing with a crimp for left hand and a right hand sloper on arete. A few slaps and crimps lead to a satisfying mantle.
content.protection: We used 2 pads and it seemed to work okay, but we were moving them as we went.
content.location: The most uphill boulder at the Airfield Area. Right handed arete over a mostly flat rock jumble.

content.description: Like Agape, but start sitting to the right of the regular start on two opposing sidepulls and some low feet. Move straight up over the prow.
content.location: In the main Airfield area, downhill roughly 20 meters and towards Leavenworth from the first Airfield Arete boulder, there is a cave/corridor feature made of several boulders nestled together. This climb is the closest to the Airfield Arete boulder, so it is the one that is most uphill in the corridor. Start sitting just under the prow with two opposing sidepulls. There will be a little rocky pit to your left.

content.description: Start matched in the left side of the cave on a blocky hold that is an incut edge, gaston, and undercling all in one. The book calls this a "gaston meatwrap." Move right to sidepulls and up over the prow. Climbs quite well.
content.location: In the main Airfield area, downhill roughly 20 meters and towards Leavenworth from the first Airfield Arete boulder, there is a cave/corridor feature made of several boulders nestled together. This climb is the closest to the Airfield Arete boulder, so it is the one that is most uphill in the corridor. Start in the left side of the overhand, sitting or crouched. There will be a little rocky pit down and to your left.
